text: George Hamilton may refer to: ==Entertainment== * George Hamilton (actor) (born 1939), American actor * George Hamilton (musician) (1901–1957), father of the actor George Hamilton * George Hamilton IV (1937–2014), American country music performer * George Rostrevor Hamilton (1888–1967), English poet and critic * George Hamilton (Resident Evil), fictional character in the video games Resident Outbreak File #1 and File #2 ==Politics== * Sir George Hamilton, 1st Baronet, of Donalong (c. 1607–1679), Irish baronet * George Hamilton, 3rd Earl of Abercorn (c. 1636 – bef. 1683), Scottish nobleman * George Hamilton, 4th Baron Hamilton of Strabane (1636/7 – 1668), Irish peer * George Hamilton, 1st Earl of Orkney (1666–1737) * George Hamilton (MP for Wells) (c. 1697–1775), Member of Parliament for Wells and for St Johnstown, Donegal * George Hamilton (1732–1793), MP for Belfast * George Hamilton (1732–1796), MP for Augher * George Hamilton-Gordon, 4th Earl of Aberdeen (1784–1860), Prime Minister of the United Kingdom in 1852–1855 * George Hamilton (city founder) (1788–1836), Canadian politician and founder of Hamilton, Ontario * George Alexander Hamilton (1802–1871), British politician and civil servant * George Baillie-Hamilton, 10th Earl of Haddington (1802–1870), British politician * Lord George Hamilton (1845–1927), British politician * Sir George Hamilton, 1st Baronet (1877–1947) of Ilford, British politician * George Wellesley Hamilton (1846–1915), Canadian politician * George Douglas-Hamilton, 10th Earl of Selkirk (1906–1994), Scottish nobleman and politician ==Religion== * George Hamilton (canon) (1718–1787), Canon of Windsor * George Hamilton (priest) (1823–1905), Archdeacon of Lindisfarne and of Northumberland ==Other== * Sir George Hamilton, Comte Hamilton (est. 1635 – 1676), Irish soldier in French service * George Hamilton (soldier) (aft. 1658 – aft. 1728), Scottish soldier, Member of Parliament for Anstruther Burghs, and Jacobite * George Hamilton (lumber baron) (1781–1839), lumber baron in the Ottawa Valley * George Ernest Hamilton (1800–1872), English civil engineer in South Australia * George Hamilton (Australian police officer) (1812–1883), senior South Australian police commissioner * George Douglas Hamilton (1835–1911), New Zealand run holder and station manager * George Henry Hamilton (1875–1948), president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City * George FitzGeorge Hamilton (1898–1918), British Army officer * George Heard Hamilton (1910–2004), professor of art history at Yale University * George Hamilton (footballer) (1917–2001), Scottish footballer * George Hamilton (broadcaster) (born 1951), association football commentator with RTÉ * George Hamilton (police officer) (born 1967), Chief Constable of the Police Service of Northern Ireland from 2014
title: George Hamilton
